definition[0]: a disease that causes death and spreads quickly to a large number of people
example[0]: drops in population levels due to plagues and famines
definition[1]: a very infectious disease that produces high fever and swollen places on the body, and often leads to death, especially bubonic plague
example[1]: The plague caused 100,000 deaths in London alone in the 1600s.
definition[2]: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time
example[2]: Financial problems continued to plague the company.
example[3]: He was plagued by eye troubles.
explanation[0]: Plague is often passive in this meaning
definition[3]: to annoy someone, especially by asking for something many times or asking them many questions
example[4]: The kids have been plaguing me with questions.
